meanings.sent1: The artist used carmine to paint the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was a lovely shade of carmine.
meanings.sent3: The carmine flowers in the garden seemed to glow in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The carmine of the sky at dusk was like a painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The carmine of the cardinal's feathers was striking against the green leaves.

meanings.definition: A pigment made from cochineal insects.
meanings.sent1: The painter mixed carmine into the paint to achieve a rich red hue.
meanings.sent2: The carmine pigment added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The carmine dye from the insects was used to color the fabric.
meanings.sent4: The carmine extracted from cochineal insects was a valuable commodity.
meanings.sent5: The carmine hue created by the insects was vibrant and long-lasting.

meanings.sent1: She decided to carmine the roses in the painting for a pop of color.
meanings.sent2: He carefully carmined the cheeks of the portrait to give them a rosy glow.
meanings.sent3: The artist playfully carmined the tips of the cat's ears in the artwork.
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to be carmined by nature itself.
meanings.sent5: The child excitedly carmined the sky in bright red crayon.
